intro: Pseudobarleria halimioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false balm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or red, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
